subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Appears in ''{{w|Zihui}}'' (Ming dynasty), as {{zh-l|*掽}}; but only attested in literary works since Qing dynasty. Probably related to {{zh-l|逢}}. <!--https://www.zhihu.com/question/50254292-->

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=pèng
|m-s=pong4
|c=pung3
|mn=phòng/tw:pōng
|mn_note=pōng - 磅 is used in the Mainland
|mc=
|oc=
|ma=y
|cat=v
}}

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[collide]]
# to [[touch]]
# to [[meet]] by chance
# to make [[contact]] with
# {{lb|zh|[[mahjong]]}} [[pong]]

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ポン}}

# {{lb|ja|mahjong|sort=ほん}} [[pung]], [[pong]]: [[call]] for a {{m|ja|明刻|tr=minkō||[[open]] or [[expose]]d [[triplet]]}} from a [[discard]]ed [[tile]], given that the player who called ''pon'' has a [[pair]] of said tiles

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|双%碰|シャン%ポン}}: [[two]]-[[side]]d wait pattern, winning tile may form a triplet with one or the other pair
